definition[0]: a tall narrow building either built on its own or forming part of a castle, church etc
example[2]: The bell tower was added to the church in 1848.
definition[1]: a tall structure, often made of metal, used for signalling, broadcasting etc
definition[2]: a tall piece of furniture that you use to store things
definition[3]: to be much taller than the people or things around you
definition[4]: to be much better than any other person or organization that does the same thing as you
example[7]: Mozart towers over all other composers.
